column4: if ls doesn't show the file then it's not there.  Can you give details of exactly what you did?

I use BT to download a file with transmission, well it downloaded it to /home/tpyoknig/download, well I needed it to be on the windows partition, do i mounted the partition with sudo mount /dev/hda5 /mnt/hda5, then i went to load the file in XP and it wasnt there so, i reboot BACK into Ubuntu and load up the termainl and do ls -la /mnt/hda5 the directory isnt there, so then i open nautilus and do a right click propet
continued: properties and it says the 2.5GB of space used, BUT 3 file on partition totaling 13.8KB, i can send ua screenshot
did you mount /mnt/hda5 when you went back into ubuntu to check?
yes i did
umount it and check, then.
nothinng
what was the exact command you used to move the file?
are you sure that /mnt/hda5 existed as a directory when you issued that command and that a filesystem was mounted to it?
im 100% sure b/c i moved the .torrent file to it b4 i moved the directory
I don't know.  I suspect that the mv operation didn't do what you think it did and the files ended up somewhere else.
in that case where? i've done a updatedb
leopard was a directory, right?
correct
try locate on one of the files inside the directory.
I suspect that the directory may have been renamed during the mv.
: http://geocities.com/twiztid0151986/screenshot-missing.png
not sure.  try to remember at least part of the name of one of the files in the directory.
did u look at my screeenshot
yes, it doesn't tell tell me much.
sorry, I'm out of ideas, my best advice is to try to remember at least part of one of the filenames inside the directory and do a locate on that.
